contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=February 2007}} '''Yisa Sofoluwe''' (born December 28, 1967?) is a former [[Nigeria]]n [[soccer|football]] [[Defender (football)|Defender]]. He won 40 caps and scored 1 goal for [[Nigeria national football team|his country]], and was their regular left back between 1983 and 1988, playing at the [[1984 African Nations Cup|1984]]<ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[RSSSF]]|author=Courtney, Barrie|title=African Nations Cup 1984 - Final Tournament Details|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tables/84a-det.html|date=2009-06-12|accessdate=2009-08-13}}</ref> and [[1988 African Nations Cup|1988]]<ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[RSSSF]]|author=Courtney, Barrie|title=African Nations Cup 1988 - Final Tournament Details|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tables/88a-det.html|date=2009-06-12|accessdate=2009-08-13}}</ref> African Nations Cups. After the 1988 season he left his club [[Abiola Babes]] to play in Belgium, where he fell into oblivion. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.nigerianplayers.com/player.asp?pID=371 Nigerian Players] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Sofoluwe, Yisa | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Footballer | DATE OF BIRTH = 1967 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sofoluwe, Yisa}} [[Category:Nigerian footballers]] [[Category:Nigerian expatriate footballers]] [[Category:Nigeria international footballers]] [[Category:1984 African Cup of Nations players]] [[Category:1988 African Cup of Nations players]] [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:Living people]] {{Nigeria-footy-bio-stub}}
